001package vector2d;
002
003import java.awt.Container;
004import javax.swing.JFrame;
005import javax.swing.Timer;
006
007/**
008 * Here is a final exercise.
009 *
010 * <p> This example features animated graphics and a class that models a kind of
011 * mathematical object that has two parts (a vector in two dimensions). </p>
012 *
013 * @author CSC140 Foundations of Computer Science
014 * @version 6 March 2013
015 */
016public class CatsCradle extends JFrame {
017
018  /**
019   * Choose values for these parameters that make a pleasing image---experiment!
020   */
021  private static final int FRAME_WIDTH = 512;
022  private static final int FRAME_HEIGHT = 512;
023  private static final String FRAME_TITLE = "Cat's Cradle";
024  private static final int NUMBER_OF_SIDES = 12;
025
026  /**
027   * Create a window on the screen, put a panel in the
028   * frame on which to draw a picture, and create a timer
029   * that will send periodic signals to the panel that ask it to
030   * redraw itself.
031   */
032  public CatsCradle() {
033    this.setSize(FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT);
034    this.setTitle(FRAME_TITLE);
035    this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
036
037    // A JFrame contains a pane to hold panels, buttons,
038    // scrollbars, and anything else we want to put into
039    // our JFrame.
040    Container pane = this.getContentPane();
041    CatsCradlePanel panel = new CatsCradlePanel(NUMBER_OF_SIDES);
042    pane.add(panel);
043
044    // The "20" here means 20 milliseconds.
045    // That means a new image 50 times per second.
046    // You can try something different.
047    // (Smaller values will result in more images
048    // per second: 10 milliseconds between images
049    // equals 100 images/second.)
050    Timer timer = new Timer(20, panel);
051    timer.start();
052
053    this.setVisible(true);
054  } // CatsCradle( int, int )
055
056  /**
057   * The execution of this program begins here.
058   * 
059   * @param args is a required array that could hold command line
060   * arguments (but we will not use any command
061   * line arguments in this example).
062   */
063  public static void main(String[] args) {
064    CatsCradle catsCradle = new CatsCradle();
065  } // main( String [] )
066} // CatsCradle
